swipe.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to hit or to try to hit someone or something by swinging your arm or an object very quickly
swipe.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: She swiped me across the face.
He jumped forward, intending to swipe at her.
swipe.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The photos were probably swiped by an employee.
swipe.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to pull a plastic card through a machine that can read the electronic information on it
swipe.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Swipe your card to open the door.
swipe.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a criticism of someone or something
swipe.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: In her latest article, she takes a swipe at  (=criticizes) her critics.
His comments were a sarcastic swipe at the police.
swipe.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: when you hit or try to hit someone or something by swinging your arm very quickly
swipe.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: She took a swipe at the ball.
swipe.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to pass a special plastic card such as a CREDIT CARD through a machine that can read the information it contains
swipe.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The system allows stores to check a customerâ€™s credit account by swiping the card through an electronic device.
